author: Akane Otani
title: U.S. Government-Bond Yields Fall as Geopolitical Tensions Rise, CPI Misses
text:
U.S. government-bond prices edged higher Wednesday, buoyed by rising geopolitical tensions and a weaker-than-expected reading on consumer prices.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note settled at 2.790%, compared with 2.799% Tuesday.
Yields, which fall as bond prices rise, dropped alongside U.S. stock futures early Wednesday...
